16: Topic Modeling

Author

Derek Sollberger

Published

November 3, 2025

Session 16: Topic Modeling

Learning objectives:

  • Review convolutions
  • Discuss Bots++
  • Introduce topic modeling
  • image source: Maarten Grootendorst

Review: Convolutions

Math

discrete convolution

\[(f * g)[n] = \displaystyle\sum_{m = -\infty}^{\infty} f[m]g[n-m]\]

continuous convolution

\[(f * g)(t) = \displaystyle\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} f(\tau)g(t-\tau) \, d\tau\]

Spatial Convolution

  • image source: spatial-lang.org

Max Pool

  • image source: Dhanush Kumar

Edge Detection

first derivative

\[f'(x) = \lim_{h \to 0} \frac{f(x + h) - f(x)}{h}\]

second derivative

\[\begin{array}{rcl} f''(x) & \approx & \frac{\frac{f(x + h) - f(x)}{h} - \frac{f(x) - f(x-h)}{h}}{h} \\ ~ & = & \frac{f(x + h) - 2f(x) + f(x - h)}{h^{2}} \\ \end{array}\]

  • image source: Jaemin Jeong, et al

bidirectional encoder representations from transformers

  • Decoder-only: GPT

generative pre-trained transformer

BERTopic

  • image source: Maarten Grootenhorst

Bots++

Bots++ is an AI-powered chatbot designed to enhance student engagement and streamline communication in Canvas courses. By integrating Bots++ into your course site, students can ask questions about course content and receive accurate, instructor-curated responses in real time. This tool helps reduce repetitive inquiries, supports students in navigating course materials, and fosters a more interactive learning environment.

—Canvas at Yale

  • image source: Princeton McGraw Center

Color Sensitivity

Setup

  • We hope to build a CNN to classify pictures in terms of susceptibility to color blindness
  • Trained model on Ishihara data set
  • Run model on novel images from the Princeton Art Museum

Future Directions

  • better data

    • increase data set by factor of 10
    • recenter, resize, rotations, shears

  • model architecture

    • more hidden layers
    • 3D convolutions
    • vary filter sizes

  • hyperparameter search

  • validate results

  • regression model

    • goal: image’s susceptibility to color vision deficiency
